active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the effectiveness of the Shared Responsibility Model in mitigating risks when using CSPs like AWS or Azure. Which party (CSP or customer) typically bears greater responsibility for misconfigurations, and why? Use NIST SP 800-30 to support arguments and address common misconceptions like 'CSPs handle all security'.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, and scaffolding. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards for the topic 'Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Risk Assessment' in Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Risk Management Concepts > Specialized Risk Management Areas > Cloud Risk Management > CSP Risk Assessment. **Context & Sources:** - Definitions: CSP (cloud services provider), Risk Assessment (identify/analyze/evaluate risks), Shared Responsibility Model (CSP/customer split), Threat/Vulnerability/Likelihood/Impact/Risk (likelihood x impact) per NIST. - Key Frameworks: NIST SP 800-30 (risk assessment guide: https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/30/r1/final), NIST SP 800-53 (security/privacy controls catalog: https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final), FedRAMP (https://www.fedramp.gov/), CSA CCM (https://cloudsecurityalliance.org/artifacts/cloud-controls-matrix-v4/). - Prerequisites: Basic risk terms, cloud models (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS). - Misconceptions: CSP handles all security; confuse threat/vuln; ignore customer configs. **Learning Objectives (Bloom's):** [Insert full list from above]. **Scaffolding Layers:** [Insert full scaffolding from above]. **Active Learning Tie-Ins:** Ensure cards prompt recall for discussions (e.g., Shared Model debate), peer teaching (definitions), problem-solving (scenarios). **Output Format (JSON Array of Cards):** Each card: {"type": "MCQ/Definition/etc.", "bloom_level": "Remember/etc.", "layer": "1-4", "front": "...", "back": "Answer | Explanation (why correct, distractors wrong if MCQ) | Source | Remediation (link to activity/objective)"}. Use schema exactly: MCQs have 4 options (A-D, mark correct), distractors per protocol (plausible misconceptions). Balance: 10 MCQs, 8 definitions, 5 application, 2 analysis/create. Make engaging, university-level, with formative assessments (e.g., self-check MCQs).
